hackathon-description-text: Toledo. Need I say more? (Even if I do I won't I mean come on you can just ask us in person)
hackathon-rules:
1) No cheating.
2) Abide by the MLH rules.
3) Have as much fun as physically possible.

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Grand prize for ToledoHacks. Each team member will get a $100 Amazon gift card and a Raspberry Pi 3.
Second place prize for ToledoHacks. Each team will receive a $50 Amazon gift card and a SanDisk 32GB microSD card.
Third place prize for ToledoHacks. Each team will receive a $25 Amazon gift card and a SanDisk 16GB microSD card.
Prize awarded to the best arts hack at ToledoHacks. Each team member will receive one Otomatone.

hackathon-prizes.prize-title: Amazon Web Services - Best Use of AWS
Best IoT Hack Using a Qualcomm Device

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Your hack should be inventive, like solving a problem that hasn't been solved.
Your hack doesn't have to be fully completed, but it must have SOMETHING finished.
Your hack should have some style and flash to it, making it look appealing to others, and attracting people.

hackathon-description-header: Inspiring interest in computer science for kids in the Toledo, Ohio area.
